entry.title: shortcuts: Set positional lookups for all accelerator maps
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the accelerator map lookup would not be set

properly whenever `RestoreAllDefaults()` gets called.

`accelerator_to_id_` gets assigned the value of

`default_accelerators_to_id_cache_` whenever all accelerators

are restored to default. The issue is that this includes the

field `use_positional_lookup`, which is not set properly in

`default_accelerators_to_id_cache_`.



The fix here is to ensure all mappings have the correct

field set when the IME updates.



Bug: b/216049298

entry.title: focus-mode: Force to show progress ring after its pulse animation
entry.content:
This CL will resolve the problem that after the pulse animation of the

progress ring for the tray, the progress ring will not show. This is

because the progress ring will not be painted when the

`ProgressIndicator` is in a completed state and there is no animation.



To resolve this problem, we set the progress to 0.999999f after the

progress ring pulse animation.

entry.title: Revert "[Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 09f8d8d5b9f04da2b9a60f79388f70e5d8f9d7cb.



Reason for revert: After discussion, we're favoring alternative approach crrev.com/c/5268982 .



Original change's description:

> [Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency.

>

> The Tab Resumption Module extracts ForeignSessionTab data and needs to

> compute tab recency for filtering and ranking. Previously the

> |timestamp| field was used, but this is prone to frequent non-user

> triggered website updates (e.g., from chat), which can also suffer from

> spam.

>

> Recently the |last_active_time| data from Sync is added to fix the

> problem. To use it, we'd need to get ForeignSessionHelper (including the

> native code) to make the data available.

>

> This CL does the above, favoring an "additive" approach to avoid unduly

> affecting existing functionality. Details:

> * ForeignSessionHelper:

> * Add class ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, which extends

> ForeignSessionTab, to have extra |lastActiveTime| field. This allows

> old code that uses ForeignSessionTab to stay the same.

> * Add getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() as replacement of

> getForeignSessions() for TRM usage, with the same interface.

> * Add pushTabWithLastActiveTime() for native code to supply the

> |lastActiveTime| data, to instantiate the new class.

> * foreign_session_helper.{cc,h}:

> * Add class Options with |get_last_active_time| field.

> * Add GetForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() for use by the

> Java counterpart.

> * Extract common code to GetForeignSessionsInternal() (private).

> * Change JNI_ForeignSessionHelper_CopyTabToJava() to selectively

> instantiate ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime if specified.

> * SuggestionEntry: Rename `timestamp` field to |timeForUi| to enforce

> proper semantics.

> * ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: Change to use

> getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() and |lastActiveTime|.

> * Explicit down-casting is applied

> * TestSupport: Update to use ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, and

> add a few |timestamp| vs. |lastActiveTime| skew in test data.

>

> Bug: 1515325

> Change-Id: I1acfc20f70066cf25b8ebab4fd74993100e42876

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5269522

> Reviewed-by: Calder Kitagawa

> Reviewed-by: Xi Han

> Commit-Queue: Samuel Huang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256952}



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: If43b91812db2766025a84756c084cea9d93927fd

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Warn when seller scripts access renderUrl.
entry.content:
Add warnings to browserSignals.renderUrl accesses made in scoreAd() and

reportWin().



This CL splits up LazyFiller into two classes - one for general use,

and another for use within the scope of ContextRecycler. The latter

isn't really necessary (since we never call Reset() on a generic

LazyFiller object we could just call Reset() on specific subclasses),

but it makes sense to have the documentation about the Reset() method

in one place, so this creates a PersistentLazyFiller subclass of

LazyFiller. PersistentLazyFiller just has a virtual Reset() method,

which LazyFiller is the same as before, except without the Reset()

method.

entry.title: [DNR] Expand excludedResponseHeaders schema to filter on values
entry.content:
Expand excludedResponseHeaders to a HeaderCondition so it can exclude

rule matches based on header values as well.



Schema:



{

// the header to exclude if this condition matches. If only this field

// is specified, this condition matches only on the header name.

string header;



// if specified, the rule is not matched if the header contains one

// of these values.

string[]? values;



// if specified, this headercondition is skipped if the header

// contains one of these values. Think of this as an "allowlist"

// for the header where if its value is in this list, the rule *can*

// still match.

string[]? excludedValues;

}



Bug: 1141166

entry.title: [Android TRM] Use last_active_time instead of timestamp for tab recency.
entry.content:
The Tab Resumption Module extracts ForeignSessionTab data and needs to

compute tab recency for filtering and ranking. Previously the

|timestamp| field was used, but this is prone to frequent non-user

triggered website updates (e.g., from chat), which can also suffer from

spam.



Recently the |last_active_time| data from Sync is added to fix the

problem. To use it, we'd need to get ForeignSessionHelper (including the

native code) to make the data available.



This CL does the above, favoring an "additive" approach to avoid unduly

affecting existing functionality. Details:

* ForeignSessionHelper:

* Add class ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, which extends

ForeignSessionTab, to have extra |lastActiveTime| field. This allows

old code that uses ForeignSessionTab to stay the same.

* Add getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() as replacement of

getForeignSessions() for TRM usage, with the same interface.

* Add pushTabWithLastActiveTime() for native code to supply the

|lastActiveTime| data, to instantiate the new class.

* foreign_session_helper.{cc,h}:

* Add class Options with |get_last_active_time| field.

* Add GetForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() for use by the

Java counterpart.

* Extract common code to GetForeignSessionsInternal() (private).

* Change JNI_ForeignSessionHelper_CopyTabToJava() to selectively

instantiate ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime if specified.

* SuggestionEntry: Rename `timestamp` field to |timeForUi| to enforce

proper semantics.

* ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: Change to use

getForeignSessionsForTabResumptionModule() and |lastActiveTime|.

* Explicit down-casting is applied

* TestSupport: Update to use ForeignSessionTabWithLastActiveTime, and

add a few |timestamp| vs. |lastActiveTime| skew in test data.



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: I1acfc20f70066cf25b8ebab4fd74993100e42876

entry.title: Protected Audience: store B&A keys in database 2/2
entry.content:
In an effort to speed up bidding and auction key fetches, store keys in the database as a second caching layer (in addition to the current in-memory cache). This CL is part 2 of 2 of this change. Part 1 provided the necessary database storage methods. This change connects the new key storage methods up through the caching storage and interest group manager classes, and uses them (behind a feature flag) in BiddingAndAuctionServerKeyFetcher.

entry.title: variations: Support *hardware_classes in field trial testing config
entry.content:
Finch configs support the `hardware_classes` and

`exclude_hardware_classes` fields [1] which limit a feature to

specific ChromeOS or Android devices. However, updating an

experiment filtered by either parameter still requires enabling the

feature in the field trial testing config.



Since the field trial testing config has no corresponding

`hardware_classes` property, the feature will be enabled too

broadly. For example, a ChromeOS feature only intended to Finch on

modern Intel devices will be forced on for all test Chromium builds

and certain CQ tests across all CrOS devices. This can result in

bugs in those builds or failing tests [2].



This CL adds `hardware_classes` and `exclude_hardware_classes` to

the field trial testing config.



[1] go/finch101#specifying-hardware-class-chrome-os-and-android-only

[2] b/317209177



Bug: b:317209177

Change-Id: I42ea14e7133259f2462046ced394f23134d0aa00

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Stop using a treeWalker to get the first text node.
entry.content:
Since we only need the first text node, using a treeWalker was

computationally expensive, since it requires processing all the

nodes before we can retrieve the first one.

entry.title: Don't reject same site prefetches with no-referrer
entry.content:
The referring URL as computed by the referrer policy for the prefetch

request was incorrectly being used to determine whether a prefetch was

cross site. This value is only meant to be used for the prefetch

request. The omission of the URL made it look like a cross site

prefetch, so the cookie eligibility check was applied.



We now use the initiating origin to determine whether a prefetch is

cross site.



Bug: 1524338

entry.title: Surface Gamepads for all OpenXr controllers
entry.content:
The WebXR Gamepads spec only has three requirements for exposing a

gamepad. These are that it must have a grip space, must target via a

tracked pointer and must have a primary input button. All three of these

are met for all of the OpenXR controllers today, and are mostly viewed

as a requirement for even enabling the controller. As such, this change

removes the "GamepadMapping" fields and then checks these three criteria

(which should basically always be true), before always attempting to

create an xr-standard gamepad.



Bug: 323949900

Change-Id: Id7b24a1b3b97231aba3fd6880e34bf76c454c77b

entry.title: Reland "viz: Move RPDQ in-flight overlay backing return to OverlayLock dtor"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9209e673978b2a74d4074fd01498a261ac1d91a6



The original change introduced a memory leak due to a mis-implemented

move operation. This change now correctly resets the l-value of a move

when it previously had a value. This could happen internally in

`base::flat_set `awaiting_release_overlay_locks_`.



The implementation of `ScopedInFlightRenderPassOverlayBackingRef` now

follows `DisplayResourceProvider::ScopedReadLockSharedImage`.



Original change's description:

> viz: Move RPDQ in-flight overlay backing return to OverlayLock dtor

>

> This CL adds a RAII type that handles releasing render pass overlay

> backing on lock release. This previously happened during

> `DidReceiveReleasedOverlays` for both macOS and Lacros but now happens

> in `SwapBuffersComplete`, which is the same place that user sources are

> released.

>

> Additionally, `DidReceiveReleasedOverlays` and

> `SkiaRenderer::awaiting_release_overlay_locks_` are made macOS-only

> since Lacros no longer needs to either to return overlay images.

>

> Bug: 1299794

> Change-Id: If4030d560d831a0789254682511fc3b81ecbdf56

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5246479

> Commit-Queue: Michael Tang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255671}

entry.title: [infra] Move targets node type declarations into an internal subdir.
entry.content:
The targets lib is becoming quite complicated, with future changes sure

to add additional complexity. To try and make it clearer to understand,

it will be reorganized into multiple files. This change moves the node

type declarations to their own file since they will be needed by nearly

every subset of the targets lib.



The following changes are being made to the node type declarations as

part of this:

* The kinds of the nodes have been updated to introduce a rudimentary

namespace (all the kinds start with "targets|").

* The documentation about the node types has been moved into README.md,

which allows for formatting and linking.

entry.title: Fix overly restrictive preferred device code
entry.content:
Without a "ForceWebXRRuntime" selection set, we were still only adding

one of the Cardboard or OpenXR providers at a time. However, if the

provider can't provide a runtime, we still need th other runtime. The

actual prioritiazation of runtimes happens in XrRuntimeManagerImpl;

though there is a slight optimization benefit to only including a

runtime if it has a chance to be used here.



This is a quick fix for the issue, a future change will look at

moving some of this logic into the XrRuntimeManagerImpl.



Bug: 41497102

entry.title: variations: Use an experiment builder in field_trial_util_unittest
entry.content:
Currently, the field_trial_util unittests construct the

FieldTrialTestingExperiment struct in place. This is suboptimal

because it's often not clear from the code what the parameters are

and adding a new field to FieldTrialTestingExperiment requires

updating every test.



Fortunately, FieldTrialTestingExperiment is sparsely populated in

all of the tests and most fields can be left as their defaults. This

CL cleans up field_trial_util_unittest by adding a builder class

that lets us more explicitly construct FieldTrialTestingExperiment.

entry.title: Don't filter out private IPv6 networks for WebRTC
entry.content:
Right now when chromium is running inside IPv6 network with only private IPv6 address available (for example local IPv6 Wi-Fi network) it will filter it out. Because of this WebRTC won't be able to gather any ICE candidates in such networks, including STUN/TURN based candidates and won't be able to establish ICE connection.



After this change Chromium shouldn't filter out private (ULA https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address) IPv6 addresses and WebRTC may expose them as ICE candidates.

entry.title: [PIX] Code validation
entry.content:
Before this patch, a page was considered to contain a PIX code if it

contained a PIX indicator string "0014br.gov.bcb.pix".



This patch adds a PIX code format validator for the renderer to run

before returning a boolean result for "is PIX code found" to the

browser.



After this patch, a page is considered to contain a PIX code only if the

found PIX code passes the rudimentary validity checks.

removed from the device, addressed in crrev.com/c/5250142.

Or when Sync is reset from the dashboard (because then the cached

passphrase wouldn't be useful anymore). Addressed in this CL.



This CL introduces ClearEncryptionBootstrapTokenForAccount, to use it

when sync is reset from the dashboard to clear the passphrase for a

specific account.

entry.title: Add WebUI warmup levels and under each level measure Tab Search startup time
entry.content:
Add an enum WebUIBubbleWarmUpLevel that describes the readiness levels

of the browser prior to showing a new WebUI bubble.



* kNoRenderer:

No render process is available. No pre-existing process, including

spare renderers, can be used or reused for this WebUI.

* kSpareRenderer:

Uses a spare render process for this WebUI.

* kDedicatedRenderer:

Uses a render process that already hosts other WebUIs prior to this

WebUI.

* kRedirectedWebContents:

Uses a WebContents that is initially on a different domain and

requires redirection to this WebUI.

This is not currently used anywhere, but worth further investigation.

* kNavigatedWebContents:

Uses a WebContents that has already navigated to this WebUI.



Add histograms Tabs.TabSearch.TimeToShow.{WarmUpLevel} to record the

startup time of Tab Search under each level. These metrics are similar

to previous metrics but have finer granularity. Specifically,



* The existing WindowTimeToShowCachedWebView2 == kNavigatedWebContents

* The existing WindowTimeToShowUncachedWebView2 is equivalent to an

aggregation of kNoRenderer, kSpareRenderer and kDedicatedRenderer.



These histogram will help us find the warm-up level that strikes the

right balance between latency and memory overhead in an effort to

improve WebUI startup time.

entry.title: Fold PaintInternalFragment() into TextPainter::Paint()
entry.content:
The PaintInternalFragment() variant is a single call

to GraphicsContext::DrawEmphasisMarks() so the "abstraction" doesn't

carry much weight. Folding PaintInternalFragment() into Paint() yields a

function of roughly the same number of source lines but a net reduction

in LoC. Move the reporting/metadata bits to be called last since the

relative order shouldn't matter - arguably this should be done a level

up in TextFragmentPainter though.

entry.title: [fuchsia][i18n] Removes the remnants of ICU config-data
entry.content:
Removes the vestiges of ICU config-data support from ICU time zone

files resolution. New builds are only ever supposed to use the new

`/config/tzdata` capability for locating ICU time zone files in

the future.



As an added bonus, we made the tzdata provision mandatory. This

uncovered a few spots where proper routing was missing. So I added

those too.



Finally, added the "if this then that" lint to warn future us about

needed co-changes to paths.



NO_IFTTT=this change introduces the lint, no synced change necessary.



Bug: 42050517, 42050075

entry.title: Update background for folder view after updating focus
entry.content:
When updating the name of a folder, pressing the return key delegates to

the default controller's for the system texfield component. The

controller then updates the active state of the component but does not

updates the focused state. This is not desired for the app list item

view where the component does not have focus when it is not active.



After SystemTextfieldController handles the event, update focus on the

texfield.



When the folder header view loses focus, make sure that the name view's

background is correctly updated.



Bug: b:321829644

entry.title: [//media] Add DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK on 1c upload w/ source legacy mailboxes
entry.content:
It is not possible for VideoFrames holding legacy mailboxes to reach

UploadVideoFrameToGLTexture(). The reason is the following:

* VideoFrames holding legacy mailboxes must have exactly one texture

* By definition, they are not using multiplanar SharedImages (since they

are not using SharedImage at all)

* This function only has two entrypoints: One from

CopyVideoFrameTexturesToGLTexture() that is conditional on the mailbox

either having more than one texture or holding a multiplanar

SharedImage, and one from CopyVideoFrameYUVDataToGLTexture(), which

itself is a codepath that is used only when the VideoFrame has no

textures.



Credit to vasilyt@, who made this point (with supporting links) here:



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5266340/comment/91febb9b_3d5edfa8/



Bug: 40062791

Change-Id: I53a8128a99e8af1485d15c97b6c5c8217c042d28

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272501

Reviewed-by: Frank Liberato

success path for now. Cacheable errors will come in a subsequent CL.

deciding the max size), so the creation logic can be more consistent

entry.title: [//gpu] Correct IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory computation of using FBO
entry.content:
As a step toward the elimination of

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_FRAMEBUFFER_HINT, this CL changes

IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory to check whether its usages imply GLES2

write without relying on that bit (instead it checks for

GLES2_WRITE as well as (RASTER_WRITE | DISPLAY_WRITE) when Skia is

using GL). This is possible now that we have introduced GLES2_WRITE and

RASTER_WRITE and ensured that they are inserted in all of the proper

client-side SharedImage creation points.



To guard against unexpected functional issues, we make this change under

a killswitch.



Bug: 41491709

Change-Id: Id5c480bc76155240dd074b24bf3974e057b35862

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272181

entry.title: [webauthn] Add view embedding TouchID
entry.content:
Add a view that embeds a TouchID prompt into webauthn UI. For now, this

code is not wired to anything, but can be triggered by running this

test:



browser_tests --gtest_filter=BrowserUiTest.Invoke \

--test-launcher-interactive \

--ui=GPMPasskeysAuthenticatorDialogTest.InvokeUi_touchid



Most of the code is lifted from crrev.com/c/4609456 with some changes to

make the view respect visibility changes.



Follow-up CLs will wire the resulting LAContext down to the enclave

entry.title: Make webview zoom API tests more robust
entry.content:
Some, but not all, of these tests verify that zoom changes

to a webview affect layout. We now verify the layout change

for the remaining tests.



I was able to reproduce some flakiness related to accessing

innerWidth after a zoom change. We now double rAF to avoid

this and re-enable the affected tests.



We also rewrite these tests using Promises to make them

more readable.
